title: Pixels, pixels, pixels  ğŸ–¼
text: Hi, I'm a computer. I see portraits as grids of pixels defined by Red, Green, and Blue (RGB) values.
ğŸ‘ˆ Check out this graph. With some instruction, I can cluster RGB values and extract 1 dominant color per image. The dominant colors in this image set are largely earth-tones, muted and dark.
There are numerous portraits (172, to be exact!) which are dominant in the grayscale. These form a straight line diagonally across the graph.
small: ğŸ Mouseover each point to explore the data.

title: Same data, new perspective ğŸ‘€
text: I can also plot the data by Red and Blue values to obtain a different view. Both perspectives reveal a similar trend, although this graph looks more dispersed. This means there is more variability of dominant colors on the blue-red spectrum.
small: ğŸ Mouseover each point to explore the data.

title: Moving up from pixel values ğŸ§
text: By repeatedly finding patterns in the data in a deep neural net, I can identify clusters that are similar in ways beyond pixel color. Since I am a machine, I don't know how these things are alike in the real world...
Can you think of names for each group?
small: ğŸ•¹ Use the scrollwheel to zoom, pan, and interact with the visual.

title: From reality to latent space ğŸš€
text: While sorting all the data into sensible clusters, I took the highly-complex data and squashed it into a lower dimensional representation. This method also produces a 'latent space encoding' of all the portraits that I can freely explore.
Now, I can produce new portraits that have not been seen before...
...Although my interpolations will be deeply affected by any biases in the dataset ğŸ¥º
small: ğŸ‘ˆ Select two portraits to take a journey through the latent space.

title: The power of deep networks ğŸ¦¾
text: I can also visualize new outputs using various controls. The sliders help us explore the landscape, but do not correspond neatly to parameters in the real world since I do not know what those are ğŸ™ƒ
small: ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ¨ To generate new portraits, [method here].

title: Et tu, Artist? ğŸ¨
text: See yourself as a portrait in the Met? Upload a photo and I'll try my best to make it happen!
small: ğŸ“· Turn on your camera to generate a portrait in your likeness.
